meta.description: The Centurion Lounge at George Bush Intercontinental Airport (IAH), Terminal D. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

lounge.name: The Centurion Lounge

location.terminalDirections: Near Gate D12, take the elevator up to the entrance.

lounge.description:
From the moment you walk in, you'll see that things are different here. Unexpected touches like a locally-inspired menu and signature cocktails meet productive workspaces with high-speed Wi-Fi

Learn more at thecenturionlounge.com/locations/iah/

warning: Food service is available as follows: Continental Breakfast 7:00 am - 7:30 am, Hot Breakfast: 7:30 am - 11:15 am, Lunch/Dinner: 11:30 am - 4:45 pm.

A limited selection of cocktail, wine, and beer will be available from 7:00 am (10:00am on Sundays) to 10:30 am. A full bar is available from 10:30 am to 4:30 pm. Must be 21 years of age or older to consume alcoholic beverages. Please drink responsibly.
regulatory: The Centurion Lounge is a day of departure lounge. Arriving Platinum and Delta SkyMiles Reserve Card Members with boarding passes for flights that have just landed will not be admitted.

Platinum and Delta SkyMiles Reserve Card Members will not be admitted more than 3 hours before the departure time on their same-day, confirmed boarding pass. This does not apply to Platinum and Delta SkyMiles Reserve Card Members with a connecting flight.

reviews.content: As with all Centurions.... too many people.
Incredible cocktails. Try the desert oasis, absolutely delicious.  Great premium food, full meal, served buffet style.  This is the best lounge in this terminal.
Pretty solid lounge. Decent array of hot food options. Solid bartender. Place was PACKED. Shower being cleaned for 2 hour? Food was pretty good, need more seats. Staff comes around for drink refills.
Spacious, comfortable, productive lounge with great selection of food and beverages all day long.
Blunt and unwelcoming receptionist, impossible to get into shower. Food was tasty and bartender friendly.
Not nearly enough space. Couldn’t find a seat at all.
Hard to find down a narrow pathway behind a duty free store to an obscure elevator in D terminal. Then a walk to entrance. Worth it!!! Large lounge. Good Space. Great food. See Charles @ the bar.
Fraudulent misrepresentation of operating hours. Arrived at 8:30 pm to find the staff removing all food items and the bar was closed. Absolute waste of time walking from Terminal D to E.
Great bar service. This lounge is accessible for visitors from Terminal A,B,C & E also. Just take the Skyway train (since Cadillac & Landry is no longer accessible to Amex Platinum members).
Friendly staff, well prepared food, great bar service. Yummy, soft choc chip cookies. (sketchy characters - not the lounge’s fault.) Worth making the diverted trek. *only go half way thru Duty Free.
Not crowded at 9:30 am on a weekday. Very good hot breakfast buffet. You can walk from D to E.
This location is very difficult to find. Find the elevators hidden inside the Duty Free shop. They do not have access to Canadian systems, so they were unable to look up my account. Disappointing.
Very rude staff up front. Food is so so. Not sure who the chef is but interesting!!!! The only positive is the other workers and the bar.
Clean, nicely decorated but inattentive staff, limited food and staff given the size of the space. Not worth a detour on a short layover.
Always a refreshing break. Excellent staff and service. Wish there were more Centurion Lounges but these are always a reason to route my trips through particular airports!
It’s a nice lounge although a bit on the smaller side. Shower yes, but no massage. They were also not letting anyone in unless they have a departure within 3 hrs, unless you just flew into IAH.
Yes it gets crowded but it goes in quick phases. Food and drink are Amex standard (awesome) and staff is totally warm and inviting. Great place and worth a little walk.
Everything good expect busy. Food selection on small side, but quality. Space small. Crowded during low traffic day. It will be overfilled during summer and holidays season. Be aware of that.
Staff here are on point. Space seems to be larger than other CL. No natural light, but still good ambiance. Elevated F&B options. Moderately busy on a Wed late-morning.
Great lounge. It is well worth the short tram ride from terminal C to D.  It’s located near gate D6. I got here at 8:30 and there was plenty of room. Food was delicious and service was great.

All you’d expect from an AMEX lounge. The only complaint is that’s a bit small for all the people always in it, might be hard to find space sometimes. Drinks are great by bartenders Charles and Tripp.
The elevator to/from the lounge wasn’t functioning when we tried to leave. The staff didn’t know how we could exit via stairwell. God forbid if there was an emergency cause the staff was oblivious.

This is only my second Centurion Lounge but it matches my expectations of the first. This one was slightly less visually appealing but was much less busy and felt more like this secret club in hiding.
Great lounge, quiet and with excellent food and bar.

All the Centurion Lounges I've been to have been very good, but this is certainly my new favorite lounge. Service is awesome, and food is awesome. Couldn't have had a better experience. HOSPITALITY!!!
Great bar, healthy food. Definitely what’s expected from Centurion.
Good food. Way too hard to get to, unless you fly international. Way too many people at 5:30pm.
First time visitor. nice decor but pretty small. Bartender very attentive and friendly. Someone mixed cleaning chemicals that created a chlorine gas situation but once that cleared up it was great!
Didn’t think we’d get to visit because our friendly desk man helped us get an earlier (!!) flight but we had time for a quick meal. Food is incredible! No bartenders at first but their drinks rocked!
Nice but not nicest of the Centurion lounges I’ve visited. Only a single shower and after waiting 30 min I had to leave for my flight. But, outstanding staff as you’d expect and good food.
It was nearly empty and there were plenty of places to sit and relax.  I don't normally transfer in IAH, but this was a really great experience - especially since MIA lounge is almost always packed.
Small compared to the United Club. Great breakfast. Hot food including eggs & potato’s. As well as cereals and oatmeal.
Great spot before any trip with good food and terrific bartenders.  Although it is starting to get a little crowded on busier travel days.
Got the card & 1 for my wife - $700+. Still not enough to admit our 3rd child. They wanted $50. Pretty absurd given they have a playroom. There is a customer that AmEx wants but a fam of 5 is not it.
Top notch as always. Charlie the bartender was a hit - sweet guy - gave good guidance through the cocktail menu and made awesome drinks. Nice ladies bathroom. Not too crowded. Lots of outlets.
Very lice lounge with a cool vibe and outstanding service.
Nice lounge, of all the Centurion lounges I have been to, this one is the least crowded. The service was amazing. Only con was no windows to see outside.
Great lattes and breakfast bar. Immaculately kept clean.
Limited breakfast foods when compared to other Centurion lounges. Wifi is also spotty and cuts frequently. Still better than any domestic lounge.
Great lounge. Top notch bar, good seating, nice atmosphere.
Very relaxing. I highly recommend.

The lounge feels opulent and clean; however, I would like to see a better selection of food with more variety. The chairs and couches are very comfy, but I expected more variety of  food and beverage.
Very nice lounge. Breakfast items consisted of fruit and dry cereal. Would like to see a better variety of food like at the Laguardia lounge.
Staff have been greatly helpful, and food is just amazing. Bar is outstanding, can't be a better lounge to relax in. Make sure to take a shower in the suite!
Good lounge with good and clean shower and good food choice.
Great food. And nice lounge. Amenities are nice but the place is a little crowded.
Looks good but the food and beverage don't live up to the hype.

Absolutely first class. Great service and beautifully appointed lounge. Only had 30 min but looking forward to dropping by on my return trip. Had a great handmade craft cocktail. B-rooms are sparkling.
Meets same high standard as all Centurions. Great local food on the menu.  Not as a large as some but plenty of room for everyone.
Quiet, clean and wonderfully stocked with food, alcohol, snacks, and showers.
I've been to 1 Amex Lounge down in MIA, so to compare this one was a lot more spacious! Food was good, shower was clean! If I'm flying out west, I'm always gonna go through IAH just for this lounge!
Had early flight and just enough time for a coffee. The lounge was a ways from my gate, but I decided to take the walk. When I entered I was given free Beyoncé tickets for the following week. Really!
Consistently great Amex lounge. A very good reason to fly IAH instead of Hobby.

Tucked away through the duty free shop, down the elevator, and a long cold hospital hallway walk away is the IAH Amex Lounge. DFW's lounge must've spoiled me. IAH felt impersonal and slapped together.
Food was good but just not that much variety. Very limited options. Drinks were great. And the service was unbelievable. Not as big as I thought it would be. It was kind of cramped at times.
Best lounge I've ever been in. Food was amazing, free--made to order drinks. My only wish is there were more of these lounges.
Newly opened and a little hard to find. Just follow the AMEX Centurion Lounge signs in terminal D adjacent to gate D6. Very good food, drinks, and service. Restrooms and shower, upscale atmosphere.
Great lounge and awesome food in here.
Amazing. Long overdue and excited it's here. The best in lounges for the US.
As noted, hard to find! Better signage needed. Comfy and the food looks good.
After first-day hiccups, this is a great lounge with nice food & drink choices, excellent staff!
To access the AMEX lounge just take the elevator right after security check. Beautiful decor, nice open space to chill, friendly service with great food and drinks. Best lounge at IAH airport.
To access the lounge you need to go into the duty free shop by D6. It's easy to miss. Go straight out of the elevator on the Mezz level. Food, drink and decor is excellent and all are complimentary!
Quiet and really lovely space w/ excellent food and super-friendly staff. A bit off the beaten path but that makes it all the more of a serene and welcome oasis.
New lounge. Very nice typical AMEX lounge. Probably the best at IAH. Good food and drink selection.
